result.execSummary:
The defendant Djordje Repac was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
No new laws rising to the level of probable cause. 
No use of possession of firearms.

Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Complete treatment as requested by the probation agent. 
Complete a cognitive thinking program. 
Complete a firearms safety class at MATC.
Random breathalyzer tests.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Djordje Repac

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Djordje Repac in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 3 days time served, consecutive to any other sentence, Huber Privileges for treatment.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- No new laws rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random breathalyzer tests.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Complete treatment as requested by the probation agent.
-  Maintain fulltime employment.
- Complete a cognitive thinking program.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Complete a firearms safety class at MATC.
- Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 

- Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court advised Defendant of his/her right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Djordje Repac in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Defense counsel request an adjournment advising the court defendant is in the hospital.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be held in person.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Djordje Repac in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case in court for a Status Conference. 
Defense request a plea and sentencing hearing. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 
This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Djordje Repac in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense counsel waiting for  discovery and offer and request an adjournment. State will follow up. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Djordje Repac in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Djordje Repac in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Djordje Repac appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
